message: I've been debating with myself between using silverlining or kraftwerk, but they both seem to do "more than just manage instances" (i.e. stuff that I would do with a configuration management software...) So I've also been thinking about rolling my own set of fabric tasks with libcloud... So many decisions, so little time! :)
Hi there!I'm interested in creating a cloud cluster that should be repeatable, highly automated and easy to maintain. I'm wondering what tool(s) do you use to spin your cloud instances into existence
Chef, there is even a Convore group for it ;-)
But there is the Clouds plugin for Trac that you could either use or borrow code from
My only experience is using knife ec2, and that seems to JFW
You can also roll your own using fabric and libcloud: http://incubator.apache.org/libcloud/
This is a very interesting question, I cannot believe Chef is the only choice around for spinning nodes.
@poswald I think @jjmaestro mentioned that combination. Rolling your own scripts doesn't seem a very good idea. How about an easy crowd tested software with very nice built-in features?
If you are using AWS, you could be using CloudFormation.
